instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damage
threads.message:
macbook pro with liquid damage from coffee. Logic board apparently without liquid damage. When connecting magsafe green light and changes to orange. But fan does not work.

Some help please I don't know where to start to find a short or a measure. Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damage
threads.message:
Do not expect fan to come on until CPU gets really hot; is normal behavior on this board.
You should try more ways to detect life on a MLB, than the spinning fan.

Do you get voltage on big coils?
